com.oceanoptics.omnidriver.features.uvvislightsource

Interface UV_VIS_LightSource


  • public interface UV_VIS_LightSource
    Interface to give access to operations for the USB_ISS_UV.

    The USB-ISS-UV/VIS Integrated Sampling System is a direct attach 1 cm cuvette holder and UV/VIS/NIR light source (200- 1100 nm) combination created specifically for use with the USB series Spectrometers. The deuterium tungsten light source receives control instructions via the 10-pin Accessory Connector on the Spectrometers.

    Intended devices include USB-ISS-UV.

    • Method Detail

      • setPowerUpPOTValues

        void setPowerUpPOTValues()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Transfers the current potentiometer values to nonvolatile memory for recall upon power up.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the plugin cannot communicate with the spectrometer.

      • setPOTValue

        void setPOTValue(int pot,
                 int value)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the specified potentiometer to the desired value.
        Parameters:
        pot - the potentiometer number.
        value - the value to set the potentiometer.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the plugin cannot communicate with the spectrometer.

      • getPOTValues

      • setLampOn

        void setLampOn(boolean lampOn)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Turns on/off both Lamps (Visible and the D2 lamp). This is the only way to turn the both lamps completely off. It also Enables/Disables the Fan. The Potentiometer values are retained in this state.
        Parameters:
        lampOn -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the plugin cannot communicate with the spectrometer.

      • isLampOn

        boolean isLampOn()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Checks the state of both Lamps (Visible and the D2 lamp).
        Returns:
        the state for the lamps (true:On, false:Off).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the plugin cannot communicate with the spectrometer.
